TEXT.English: Stronger but more expensive and with a lower withdrawal rate than Horse Archers, this unit makes for a decent knight substitute.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Heavy cavalry is a class of cavalry whose primary role was to engage in direct combat with enemy forces. Although their equipment differed greatly depending on the region and historical period, they were generally mounted on large powerful horses, and were often equipped with some form of scale, plated, chainmail or lamellar armour as well as either swords, maces, lances, or battle axes.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Heavy cavalry is a class of cavalry whose primary role was to engage in direct combat with enemy forces. TEXT.English: The strongest footsoldier of the game, use this unit to hold the ground gained by your tanks and planes.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The infantry is the branch of a military force that fights on foot. As the troops who are intended to engage, fight, and defeat the enemy in face-to-face combat, they bear the brunt of warfare and typically suffer the greatest number of casualties. Historically, as the oldest branch of the combat arms, the infantry are the tip of the spear of a modern army, and continually undergo training that is more physically stressful and psychologically demanding than that of any other branch of the combat arms.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A police force is a constituted body of persons empowered by the state to enforce the law, protect property, and limit civil disorder. Their powers include the legitimized use of force. The term is most commonly associated with police services of a sovereign state that are authorized to exercise the police power of that state within a defined legal or territorial area of responsibility. Police forces are often defined as being separate from military or other organizations involved in the defense of the state against foreign aggressors.

TEXT.German: "Die Partei, die Partei, die hat immer Recht!"

TEXT.English: In local government, a city hall, town hall, civic centre, guildhall, or (more rarely) a municipal building, is the chief administrative building of a city, town, or other municipality. It usually houses the city or town council, its associated departments, and their employees. It also usually functions as the base of the mayor of a city, town, borough, or county. The local government may endeavor to use the town hall building to promote and enhance the quality of life of the community. In many cases, town halls serve not only as buildings for government functions, but also have facilities for various civic and cultural activities. These may include art shows, stage performances, exhibits and festivals. Modern town halls or "civic centres" are often designed with a great variety and flexibility of purpose in mind. City hall buildings may also serve as cultural icons that symbolize their cities.
TEXT.French: In local government, a city hall, town hall, civic centre, guildhall, or (more rarely) a municipal building, is the chief administrative building of a city, town, or other municipality. It usually houses the city or town council, its associated departments, and their employees. It also usually functions as the base of the mayor of a city, town, borough, or county. These may include art shows, stage performances, exhibits and festivals. Modern town halls or "civic centres" are often designed with a great variety and flexibility of purpose in mind. City hall buildings may also serve as cultural icons that symbolize their cities.

TEXT.English: City Halls provide a free statesman, a statesman slot, and a free specialist for every town in the city radius.
TEXT.French: City Halls provide a free statesman, a statesman slot, and a free specialist for every town in the city radius.
TEXT.German: City Halls provide a free statesman, a statesman slot, and a free specialist for every town in the city radius.

TEXT.Spanish: City Halls provide a free statesman, a statesman slot, and a free specialist for every town in the city radius.

TEXT.German: Kulturelles Goldenes Zeitalter: %d1_Progress/%d2_Threshold (%D3[ICON_CULTURE] in dieser Runde)

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cristo Redentor[COLOR_REVERT] allows its builder to switch [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Religions[COLOR_REVERT] or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Civics[COLOR_REVERT] instantly once per turn, with no anarchy. It also increases the chances of a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Prophet[COLOR_REVERT] appearing.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Christ rédempteur[COLOR_REVERT] permet à son constructeur de changer de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]religion[COLOR_REVERT] ou de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]doctrine[COLOR_REVERT] instantanément, une fois par tour et sans période d'anarchie. Il augmente aussi les chances qu'un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Prophet[COLOR_REVERT] apparaisse.
TEXT.German: Die [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cristo Redentor[COLOR_REVERT]-Statue ermöglicht ihrem Erbauer, einmal pro Runde augenblicklich die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Religion[COLOR_REVERT] oder [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Staatsform[COLOR_REVERT] zu wechseln, ohne dadurch Anarchie zu verursachen. Sie erhöht auch die Wahrscheinlichkeit, dass ein [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Großer Prophet[COLOR_REVERT] auftaucht.
TEXT.Italian: Il [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cristo Redentore[COLOR_REVERT] permette a chi lo costruisce di cambiare [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Religione[COLOR_REVERT] o [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Forma di governo[COLOR_REVERT] istantaneamente una volta per turno, senza generare anarchia. Aumenta inoltre le probabilità che appaia un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Prophet[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cristo Redentor[COLOR_REVERT] permite a su constructor cambiar instantáneamente de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]religión[COLOR_REVERT] o de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]principios[COLOR_REVERT] una vez por turno, sin sufrir los efectos de la anarquía. También aumenta las posibilidades de que aparezca un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Prophet[COLOR_REVERT].
